data.title: No output when debug port in use
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**

Ubuntu 14.04. Godot 2.1.3

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->

No output when running (console).

**Steps to reproduce:**

This seems to happen when something is using the debug port. See reports https://godotengine.org/qa/9453/debugger-and-output-malfunction and https://godotengine.org/qa/630/output-debug-messages-suddenly-stop-working-possible-causes.

No message showing what happened. You just have to know that is the issue (and then change the debug port number in Debug settings).

**Link to minimal example project:**
<!-- Optional but very welcome. You can drag and drop a zip archive to upload it. -->

data.title: Fix destruction of subclasses of Object
data.body:
`free()` and `queue_free()` were failing to call the destructor of the actual object type.

~~__UPDATE:__ Causing issues in 3.0 while 2.1 seems to be fine with it. I'll research and report.~~

__UPDATE:__ Now implemented more cleanly and with no issues so far.

data.title: Fix destruction of subclasses of Object (2.1)
data.body:
`free()` and `queue_free()` were failing to call the destructor of the actual object type.

__NOTE:__ Not to be merged before #8999 as this one uncovers some several object lifetime bugs in the physics engine which leads to crashes.

__UPDATE:__ Now implemented more cleanly.

Note that here I didn't rename WinRT to UWP.

data.title: 2.1 branch release debug, editor crashes
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Ubuntu 17.04 x86_64
Godot _**2.1 branch release_debug**_

**Issue description:**
I compiled 2.1 branch with release debug option and the editor crashes randomly, or when I press control-F to search a script or when saving a scene. 

**_On launch terminal prints:_**
_ERROR: move_child: Invalid new child position: 2
   At: scene/main/node.cpp:269.
ERROR: move_child: Invalid new child position: 2
   At: scene/main/node.cpp:269._

It doesn't crash when compiling without target=release_debug

**Steps to reproduce:**
Attach a script and press control - F inside it, or save a scene.

**Link to minimal example project:**
<!-- Optional but very welcome. You can drag and drop a zip archive to upload it. -->

data.title: Sugar $ produce syntax error if it contains an expression name
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
3.0 master Linux

**Steps to reproduce:**
- Create an object named: var, if, continue, onready ...
- Use $ to select said object, example: $buttons/continue
- In this case editor reported error: Expected end of statement (continue)

data.body:

There is no response form refraction and prallax depth is not giving the desired result! 
While omni , spot light is giving coloured relection and reflection on glossy surface is giving black reflection!

data.title: added style for panel class
data.body: There was no style in the default editor theme for the panel class. the color didn't fit at all (upper image is old version, lower one with this change): I added a style for the background (dependent on the theme color) This basically makes "Background", "EditorStyles" obsolete... The advantage of still having it, is, that you can customise the background independent form panels...

data.title: Fix InputEvent-related Android build issues
data.body: I also had to disable the `tinyexr` module because it wouldn't build on Android, but I don't think that's related to this.

data.title: Running a project without main doesn't actually run after selecting main
data.body: When you hit run on your new project with no main selected, it prompts you to select a main scene. When you select a main scene, you get thrown back to the editor, and nothing happens. The project should be run automatically after you select a main as prompted.

data.title: Running an unsaved scene doesn't actually run after saving
data.body: When you hit run on your new project with an unsaved scene, it prompts you to save the unsaved scene. When you save the scene, you get thrown back to the editor, and nothing happens. The project should be run automatically after you save the scene as prompted.

data.title: When creating a new project, automatically enter Edit mode
data.body:
From the project list window:
-press [new project]
-enter relevant path & name
-press [create]
At this point, you get thrown back to the project list window. I'd suggest a more intuitive and useful action would be to begin editing the new project the moment you press the [create] button.

data.title: queue_free doesn't work if node has been removed from the SceneTree
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Mac OS and Android, at least

**Issue description:**
The `queue_free` function doesn't free objects from memory if they aren't in the SceneTree.


**Steps to reproduce:**
Call `queue_free()` on a node that had been removed from the SceneTree via `remove_child`, the object count doesn't change and NOTIFICATION_PREDELETE never occurs. Using call_deferred('free') works.

**Link to minimal example project:**
[queue_free bug tester.tscn.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1056339/queue_free.bug.tester.tscn.zip)


In the project, if the main node's "fix" script variable is false, it deletes "Child" via `queue_free`, and if true, it uses `call_deferred('free')`, when the "Child" node is deleted, it should print "Success!" to the console.

data.title: [3.0] New action in input map breaks the project.
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Debian 9 - 3.0

**Issue description:**
If I try to add a new action in input map, godot stops to recognize the project and I can't work on it.

This is the line for the error:

```
ERROR: _load_settings: GlobalConfig::load - /home/victor/Godot 3/Centipide/Client/project.godot:25 error: Expected identifier with type of object
   At: core/global_config.cpp:433.
```

And this is the line in the config file:

```
[input]

player_sprint=[ Object(InputEventKey,"resource_local_to_scene":false,"resource_name":"","alt":false,"shift":false,"control":false,"meta":false,"command":false,"pressed":false,"scancode":32,"unicode":0,"echo":false,"script":null)
 ]
```

data.title: renamed all Rect3.pos to Rect3.position
Continuous CD not working
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:** 
2.1.3 Stable (64-bit)


**Issue description:**
The Rigidbody2D node does not appear to have correctly functioning Continuous Collision Detection (even thought the option is present).  "Tunneling" occurs with both "Cast Ray" and "Cast Shape" options.


**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Create a Rigidbody2D node and enable Continuous CD in it's properties (Cast Ray or Cast Shape).
2. Create an Area2D node as a child of the Rigidbody2D node (so it has mass). 
3. Place the Rigidbody2D node overtop of a ColliderObject2D node (make it static because it should never move anyway).
4. Set gravity scale to something large, like ... I dunno... 300 or something.
5. Run the game, watch your Rigidbody2D either pass through the static collider or tunnel into it slightly.


I have tried both options (Cast Ray and Cast Shape) and neither of them seem to work.  Looking back on previous issues posted here (and elsewhere), it appears Continuous CD was broken since version 2 of Godot was released and never got fixed.  Is there any chance this can be corrected soon?  It impacts a lot of my testing currently.

data.title: Fix Script Editor stealing focus on class search text changed
data.body:
Described by nunodonato in #8971 

> 1. open godot in 2d/3d mode
> 2. help->classes
> 3. type something in the search box
> 
> notice the script editor opened in the back and gained the focus. your typing is now in the editor instead of the search box of the window in front

data.title: Saving scripts with the shortcut (CTRL+S) does not work with empty scene
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:** 
Ubuntu Linux 16.04 - Godot 3.0 master branch (cloned 4 hours ago)

**Issue description:**

Trying to save scripts with the save shortcut (CTRL+S) does not work until an existing scene is 
opened or a valid scene with root node is saved.
Message: "This operation can't be done without a tree root"

**Steps to reproduce:**

Open an empty or existing project and close all open scenes. Open an empty or existing script in 
the script editor and press (CTRL+S).
